articles.title: US to consider visa restrictions over Uganda anti-gay law - Al Jazeera English
articles.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says legislation, which includes the death penalty, is deeply troubling.
articles.content:
Secretary of State Antony Blinken says the United States may consider restricting visas for some Ugandan officials after the country adopted one of the worlds toughest anti-LGBTQ laws.

articles.title: UAE announces groundbreaking mission to asteroid belt, seeking clues to life's origins - Phys.org
articles.description: The United Arab Emirates unveiled plans Monday to send a spaceship to explore the solar system's main asteroid belt, the latest space project by the oil-rich nation after it launched the successful Hope spacecraft to Mars in 2020.

articles.author: Jonathan Chadwick
articles.title: Earth has a new 'MOON' - and it's here for at least 1500 years - Daily Mail
articles.description: The 'quasi-moon', called 2023 FW13, was discovered by experts using the Pan-STARRS telescope at the top of the Haleakala volcano in Hawaii.
articles.content:
Earth has a new moon - or at least a 'quasi-moon', a new study has revealed. 
A quasi-moon is a space rock that circles the Earth, but is gravitationally bound by the sun. 
This quasi-moon, called … [+5593 chars]

articles.title: Breaking the Cosmic Silence: First Detection of Radio Waves From Type Ia Supernova - SciTechDaily
articles.description: An unusual Type Ia supernova has been discovered by Stockholm University astronomers. For the first time, it was detected in radio waves and showed strong helium emissions. The supernova was triggered by a white dwarf star that pulled helium-rich material fro…
articles.content:
